document_data.name: Althallan Crownsilver
document_data.basicrefs: {{Cite dragon/281/The New Adventures of Volo: Lost Treasures of Cormyr, Part 4|76}}
document_data.mainbody: '''Althallan Crownsilver''' was a member of [[House Crownsilver]], a noble family in [[Cormyr]]. He ascended to the head of the family for a short time in the early 13{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Description: Althallan was of small stature, but moved with feline grace. He had luxurious red hair and large dark-blue or indigo eyes that made him appear almost feminine.
document_data.Personality: His wit was as quick and sharp as his swords.
document_data.Abilities: Despite being a small man, Althallan had a great capacity for alcohol and could drink much larger men under the table. He was quite good at wielding two [[rapier]]-like [[longsword]]s simultaneously. He had no qualms about using a large drinking vessel as a missile weapon.
document_data.Activities: According to the notorious divulger of secrets, [[Volothamp Geddarm]], Althallan and his friend [[Donder Cormaeril]] concocted a scheme to put pressure on western [[Sembian]] merchants and holdings by secretly supporting the so-called [[Hullack Hawk]]—a bandit that attacked Sembian interests and fled into the [[Hullack Forest]]—and publicly directing the blame toward [[Eltrym Drauthglas]], the Lord of Hullack.{{Cite dragon/281/The New Adventures of Volo: Lost Treasures of Cormyr, Part 4|77}}
document_data.History: Althallan once foiled an assassination attempt that happened after a bout of drinking. All the other nobles involved were intoxicated to the point of impairment, but Althallan had the wherewithal to intercept and slay the killer.
document_data.Rumors & Legends: Although unproven, Volo posited that the Hullack Hawk was none other than [[Beldarm Truesilver]] in disguise, doing the bidding of, or at least in league with, Althallan and Donder.
